chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Lee Varela was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

records.addlTxt:
02:38 PM Defendant Jason Lee Varela by phone with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State notes this is an initial appearance. Upon waiver of preliminary hearing, would plead to ct 1, dismiss and read in remaining counts. Sentence of 20 years WSP structured as 5 years initial confinement and 15 years extended supervision. 226 days credit. Conditions of ES Programming as per DOC. Pay court costs, no contact with victims 1 and 2. He is eligible for both programs. Sentence would be concurrent with sentence now being served.
Att Repka agrees
Court reviews right to prelim
Defendant waives prelim, pleads guilty to count 1, Waives personal appearance.
Court questions defendant, finds plea is voluntary, judgment is entered on count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed but read in. 
Defendant makes statement
Court-  Sentence of 20 years WSP structured as 5 years initial confinement and 15 years extended supervision. 226 days credit. Conditions of ES Programming as per DOC. Pay court costs. No contact with victims 1 and 2. Identifies victims for defendant. He is eligible for both programs. Sentence would be concurrent with sentence now being served.

01:19 PM Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by phone means for Defendant Jason Lee Varela. Prosecuting Atty Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason Lee Varela not in court. Attorney Repka has been unable to contact defendant at facility he is incarcerated at. Parties in agreement to reset the matter. Court resets plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:01 PM Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by phone means for Defendant Jason Lee Varela #447715. Prosecuting Atty Angela M Wilson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Repka notes defendant is in lockdown at a facility and cannot appear by phone. Court resets plea/sentencing date with parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Jason Lee Varela appeared by phone means with Attorney Daniel Repka by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Repka states defendant would like the matter to be rescheduled for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
